page.title: 05ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH
page.content: {Environmental Health in Rotherham. The role of the department has come a long way since the "nuisance" man. Volumes of legislation ensure the protection and general welfare of the town's residents. Areas of responsibility are housing, pollution, food hygiene and health and safety. Advice is give to householders on statutory nuisances, and grants are given for housing repairs and modernisation. The bi-products from local manufacturing industries are monitored and smokeless zones ensure that the air is clean. Checks are made for the levels of asbestos, lead and acid rain. The pest control team handle 3,000 requests annually, dealing with disease carrying insects and vermin. In recent years Rotherham spearheaded the pollen/hayfever bureau.
